definitions.text: an air mass of lower pressure; often brings precipitation
examples: a low moved in over night bringing sleet and snow

definitions.text: British political cartoonist (born in New Zealand) who created the character Colonel Blimp (1891-1963)
a low level or position or degree
examples: the stock market fell to a new low

definitions.text: the lowest forward gear ratio in the gear box of a motor vehicle; used to start a car moving
make a low noise, characteristic of bovines
less than normal in degree or intensity or amount
literal meanings; being at or having a relatively small elevation or upward extension

examples: the low-toned murmur of the surf

definitions.text: used of sounds and voices; low in pitch or frequency

examples: his miserable treatment of his family

definitions.text: low or inferior in station or quality
examples: a modest man of the people

definitions.text: subdued or brought low in condition or status

examples: gloomy at the thought of what he had to face
took a grim view of the economy
lonely and blue in a strange city
depressed by the loss of his job
a dispirited and resigned expression on her face

definitions.text: in a low position; near the ground
